snippet: An appeals court said the designer Christian Louboutin had an enforceable trademark for red outsoles, but let Yves Saint Laurent sell its monochromatic red shoes.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that designer Christian Louboutin has a valid and enforceable trademark for red outsoles on its high-heel shoes, but only when the rest of the shoe is of a contrasting color; ruling stems from a judge's earlier refusal to grant a preliminary injunction against Yves Saint Laurent for selling monochrome red high-heel shoes with a red outsole, which Louboutin claimed infringed on its trademarked design.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court said the designer Christian Louboutin had an enforceable trademark for red outsoles, but let Yves Saint Laurent sell its monochromatic red shoes.

headline.seo: Court Rules Louboutin Can Enforce a Trademark on Its Red Outsoles
headline.main: Shoe Designer Can Protect Its ‘Pop’ of Red, Court Says
headline.print_headline: Shoe Designer Can Protect Its ‘Pop’ of Red, Court Says
